parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being considered electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered candidate's campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "PSD" (Partidul Social Democrat). This directly refers to a parliamentary candidate, fulfilling condition "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide geographical area (Botoșani County and surrounding areas) and age range (18-65). This clearly addresses the wide population, fulfilling condition "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's message ("PSD te-a vrut tăcut... A venit vremea schimbării! NOI suntem VOCEA! NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!") strongly suggests an electoral objective. It aims to influence voters by criticizing the PSD and promoting an alternative ("NOI suntem VOCEA"). The call to action ("NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!") directly encourages voting, likely against the PSD. This fulfills condition "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objectivity and presents a clear partisan viewpoint, criticizing the PSD and promoting a specific alternative.  It's not providing news or analysis but rather opinion and advocacy.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clearly structured political message aimed at swaying voters. The use of strong emotional language ("tăcut, încremenit, ireal") and a clear call to action indicates an intention to influence the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1824225495050389</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a specific political party (PSD), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has a clear electoral objective: to influence voters against the PSD. The content is not journalistic in nature; it's partisan advocacy.  The timing of the post (after the official campaign period) is crucial.  While the exact end date of the campaign is not specified, if this post was published after the legal deadline for electoral propaganda, it constitutes a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea Dorohoi</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Vocea Dorohoi, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1824225495050389) cu conținut de propagandă electorală, care îndeplinește toate criteriile articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, având ca efect electoral influențarea negativă a voturilor pentru PSD prin critici directe și un apel la acțiune ("NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!"),  în ciuda încheierii perioadei legale de campanie.  Postarea, fiind o reclamă plătită pe Facebook, vizează o audiență largă din județul Botoșani și împrejurimi,  transmițând un mesaj clar împotriva PSD și promovând o alternativă neidentificată, dar implicită.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
